channel.title: My compile dont run
channel.description: How can I fix compile? I I'll start this, but says javac is not recognized as an internal or external script file, which is a bug

item.title: My compile dont run
item.dc:creator: @jerkku jerkku
item.description:
@jerkku wrote:

[quote=“Opium10, post:3, topic:350179”]What java are you using, what verison?

I suggest downloading the newest JDk it’s 6 update 21. Make this your compiler

@echo off title (Yourserver) Compiler if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit[/quote] This works thanks

Read full topic

item.title: My compile dont run

item.description:
@Opium10 wrote:

What java are you using, what verison?

I suggest downloading the newest JDk it’s 6 update 21. Make this your compiler

@echo off title (Yourserver) Compiler if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

item.title: My compile dont run
item.dc:creator: @Nameme123 Nameme123
item.description:
@Nameme123 wrote:

You’ll be able to fix this by right clicking and editing it. Then locate it to your jdk files and into the bin and onto the javac.exe thing.
It’s because the person who made the compiler set the jdk as a different version.

You can use JDK and JRE.

-Nameme123

Read full topic
